programme.desc: The murder of a millionaire doctor's wife sets off a massive manhunt throughout New England; law enforcement quickly locates the suspected killer only to find out he has a history of not only violence but also cross-dressing.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: An unemployed teen mom and her new husband concoct a plan to kill an innocent man they meet on Craigslist, resulting in a vicious stabbing that sends shock waves through a small Pennsylvania community.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman is actually a sadomasochistic con-man who lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A wayward, homeless ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, committing petty crimes here and there, until he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From dominant dynasties to wild underdog stories and Super Bowl thrillers, NFL Throwback takes a deep dive into the 2000s.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Chicago rallies 16 points in the fourth quarter as the 'Cardiac Bears' attempt to take down the reigning NFC North champion Lions in the regular season finale of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Broncos complete one of the wildest comebacks in NFL history, scoring 33-points in the fourth quarter to rally from a 19-0 Giants' lead in a crazy game between the Jaxson Dart led Giants and the Bo Nix led Broncos.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Chicago Bears had 4 takeaways for the 2nd game in a row, allowing them to survive a middling performance by Caleb Williams and Ben Johnson's offense. Josh Blackwell blocks a field goal to preserve the Bears' rally for a 25-24 win over the Las Vegas Raiders. The Bears also spoiled a breakout performance by Ashton Jeanty, who rushed for 138 yards on 21 carries and became the first Raiders rookie with three touchdowns in game since Bo Jackson in 1987 against Seattle.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: In a stirring battle between 2 rookie quarterbacks, Pick No. 40 came out on top of Pick No. 1 as the New Orleans Saints rallied to beat the Tennessee Titans 34-26 on Sunday at Nissan Stadium in Nashville.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Buffalo Bills rally from a 21-point deficit to beat the New England Patriots 35-31, to stay alive in the AFC East's playoff race.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Bryce Young breaks the Panthers franchise record for passing yards in a game as Carolina rallies from a 14-point deficit in an overtime thriller against the Atlanta Falcons.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tony Pollard rushed for a career-high 161 yards and two touchdowns as Tennessee averaged 5.3 yards per carry. The defense forced a pair of turnovers in the second half and the special teams blocked a punt.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCAR‚Äôs Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Relive three of the most impactful weeks in Carson Hocevar‚Äôs life, where he had a shot to win three races in a row.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After a dreary start to the season, Rajah Caruth claims his second career win in Nashville. Jesse Love relives the most challenging years of his life before returning to his home track in Sonoma. Amidst the August heat in Daytona Beach, Carson Hocevar has one last shot to prove he‚Äôs a playoff driver.

programme.desc: From Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston Salem, N.C.

programme.desc: From Daytona International Speedway.

Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: With 26 sealed briefcases full of varying amounts of cash, ranging from a penny to $1m - contestants decide whether to accept an offer of cash from 'the Banker,' in exchange for what might be contained in the contestant's chosen briefcase.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Plants that have a head for heights come under the spotlight. At Craigieburn Garden in the Scottish Borders there is a unique collection of Himalayan plants, plus a look at a nurseryman in Hebden Bridge who has been growing alpines since he was a teenager.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don's box hedges are still riddled with blight, so it's time to call in an expert to decide on the next course of action. He also has a go at growing some mushrooms in the hope of picking a bumper crop in the autumn. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame visits the garden at Highclere Castle in Berkshire - the filming location for Downton Abbey.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein catches up with Geoff and Sally Davis to see how their garden renovation project is coming along. And Monty Don is at Longmeadow enjoying the fruits of his labour, with plenty of seasonal advice in store.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Bank Holiday weekend and there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don takes stock of what's worked and what hasn't at Longmeadow, with a view to planning ahead to the autumn. Meanwhile, James Wong goes behind the scenes at Bristol Zoo to find out more about how the animals are kept fed throughout the year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst enjoying the late season colour in the Jewel Garden as the summer begins to fade, Monty Don turns his attention to his spring borders which are in need of refurbishment if they are going to pack a punch early next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow with a host of seasonal jobs to keep his autumn garden looking beautiful for as long as possible, and in the third of her fascinating films about how plants work, Carol Klein investigates the science of stems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the fourth of her films about botany, Carol Klein explores the inner workings of leaves - how they harness the sun's energy and turn it into food. Joe Swift meets Griff Rhys Jones for a private tour of his remarkable garden and discovers what a passionate gardener he is.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: A remnant of the last Ice Age, the musk ox is almost mythical in appearance. For the people who share the Barren Ground region of Canada with them, they are an integral part of their culture. Show host, Dan Cabela, participates in a scientific sampling project to monitor the population's health, and get first-hand experience of the relationship between local people and this arctic icon.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela sets out to pursue, capture and aid in the conservation of the tallest land mammal in North America ‚Äì the Moose.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explores the challenges and research behind living with Africa‚Äôs most secretive predator - the Leopard.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn‚Äôt think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin‚Äôs boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world‚Äôs luckiest fish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything‚Äîand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it‚Äôs bigger than ever. This time, we‚Äôre in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida‚Äôs most critical ecosystems. But it‚Äôs not just about hard work‚Äîit‚Äôs about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don‚Äôt miss Part 1‚Äîwhere conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Dirt

programme.title: Dirt

As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he‚Äôll meet plenty of farmers and foragers‚Äîharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: A remnant of the last Ice Age, the musk ox is almost mythical in appearance. For the people who share the Barren Ground region of Canada with them, they are an integral part of their culture. Show host, Dan Cabela, participates in a scientific sampling project to monitor the population's health, and get first-hand experience of the relationship between local people and this arctic icon.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything‚Äîand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it‚Äôs bigger than ever. This time, we‚Äôre in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida‚Äôs most critical ecosystems. But it‚Äôs not just about hard work‚Äîit‚Äôs about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don‚Äôt miss Part 1‚Äîwhere conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Dirt

It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family‚Äôs traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he‚Äôll meet plenty of farmers and foragers‚Äîharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: The heroic mariner must clear all sorts of hurdles in the way of rescuing a princess who‚Äôs been miniaturized and held captive by a ruthless magician.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: Twentieth Century
programme.desc: When down-on-his-luck Broadway impresario Oscar Jaffe (John Barrymore) meets his discovery and former flame, Lily Garland (Carole Lombard), on the glamorous 20th Century Limited train between Chicago and New York, he uses every scheme at his disposal to win the movie star back both professionally and romantically. However, Lily, along with her new beau, George (Ralph Forbes), and Jaffe's rival producer, Max Jacobs (Charles Levison), who hired Lily to star in his latest play, have other plans.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Blazing the Western Trail
programme.desc: Noble cowboy the Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) gets snared in a vicious feud between two warring stagecoach operations. One of the two has been recently willed to spitfire Mary Halliday (Carole Mathews), whose father the Kid suspects was murdered by a business rival. With the help of his trusted friends Tex Harding (Tex Harding) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor), the Kid hopes to uncover the truth while hiding the investigation from the strident Miss Halliday.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.desc: Military officers compete for the same woman while training pilots for war.

programme.desc: On Valentine's Day, Tani and Noelani are held hostage during a convenience store robbery; the team investigates the murder of a Thai diplomat whose wife confesses to the crime, but Danny suspects she's covering for the real killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's ‚Äì but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.desc: Carver Valley‚Äôs comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Behind The Movement
programme.desc: A unique and fast paced retelling of how Rosa Parks refusal to give up her seat launched the history making Montgomery Bus Boycott. This ticking clock styled film recounts the inner workings and the behind the scenes preparation that took place in three intense days to pull the most successful boycott of it's time.

programme.title: Girl Friends Getaway
programme.desc: Four longtime friends become embroiled in a kidnapping and a robbery after traveling to Trinidad for a birthday getaway.

programme.title: Girl Friends Getaway II
programme.desc: Chaos strikes when a gushing bride (Garcelle Beauvais) and her three friends (Essence Atkins, Terri J. Vaughn) travel to San Juan, Puerto Rico, for an exotic wedding.

programme.title: White Water
programme.desc: White Water is the story of a 7 year-old black kid in segregated 1963 Opelika, Alabama who becomes obsessed with the desire to taste the water from the "white's only" drinking fountain and sets out on a quest to do the unthinkable: drink from it.

programme.title: Welcome to the Family
programme.desc: Welcome to the Family centers on Stella, an internet producer (Kali Hawk), who has to learn how to balance her personal and professional lives. programme.desc: On this hour-long episode Danny is doubly-blessed when a His and Hers restoration--a 1970 Plymouth Road Runner and a 1970 Dodge Coronet--are commissioned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny conspires with a proud dad to give the ultimate surprise 16th birthday gift, and the shop frustrates a customer with a design error.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A couple from Miami enlists Danny and the Counts Kustom crew to raise money and awareness to combat a very rare disease.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Get revved up when Danny spots a killer 1967 Pontiac GTO at one of the biggest car shows in Vegas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Chevys and Fords strive to break past six figures on the auction block as various vehicles sell for no reserve at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The attention shifts to American-made rides as an incredible selection of Dodges, Chevrolets, and Fords crosses the auction block, with options ranging from a 1939 Ford Custom Roadster to a 1956 Ford Thunderbird Convertible.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidders battle it out as they try to gain ownership of the one-of-a-kind cars coming across the auction block in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bidders compete over one of the greatest collections of Ford Shelbys in Barrett-Jackson history, as well as a wide offering of Chevys; Craig Jackson and Steve Davis give an inside look at the 1976 custom Ford wagon, El Chapo.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Two hydrocars, including a 1965 Amphicar Convertible, cross the auction block along with Blackwings, two of the most powerful Cadillacs ever built, which are sold for a good cause.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mr. Las Vegas, Wayne Newton, takes to the block to see cars from his personal collection go under the hammer, including a one-of-a-kind '81 Mercedes Benz 380SL custom, a '99 Rolls Royce Silver Seraph and a '79 Rolls Royce Silver Shadow.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Porsche is featured in this episode along with some of the greatest vehicles the world has ever seen, all auctioned at no reserve in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The wheels are spinning as Barrett-Jackson descends on Las Vegas for the 2022 season; highlighting bidders beating the odds and taking home collectible cars.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Barrett-Jackson Live auctions continue in Texas, introducing custom cars to the auction block; from a 1962 Chevrolet Corvette to a 1956 Ford F-100 Big Window, there is a car of choice for all car loves at the Houston auctions.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Lone Star State does not disappoint as the Barrett-Jackson live auctions continue in Houston, Texas; attention shifts to luxury cars as models like the 2014 Bentley Continental GTC and 1991 Ferrari 348 TS Targa come across the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From a 1971 Custom Chevy C-10 Deluxe Pick-Up all the way to a 1984 AM General M923 6x6, there is an option for every pick-up lover.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Scottsdale Auction heats up on Super Saturday as customs, classics and moderns drive across the auction block; from a 1929 Ford Model A custom roadster to a 2020 Ford Shelby, bidding is in full swing with prices soaring into six figures.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As dawn breaks over the Pacific Northwest, this year's Ax Men prepare for the battle that lies ahead. Behind every turn, danger lurks.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle has just begun, and already, men are bowing out of the race.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Ax Men soar to new heights as a helicopter logging outfit enters the competition. At Pihl, Dustin tries to talk his father into coming back to work.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, the bosses clash over greenhorn Brad. Meanwhile, at the Pihl team, Dwayne is forced to do the job of a greenhorn.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The mountain's men face the firing squad. Rygaard's greenhorn fights to keep his job, but the bosses may pull the plug before he gets his chance.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The mountain seeks its revenge. Weather traps R&R's helicopter pilot in the fog. Trees fight back against Pihl's timber fallers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The tables are turned and the mountain's underdogs get their chance. Jimmy Smith finds the holy grail of underwater logs when he attempts to pull a dock out of the water.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Dead weight must be shed. Inexperienced hook tender Jesse Browning, junior pilot Steve Smith, and greenhorn Brad Hewitt.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: New faces are welcomed to the fraternity of men known as Ax Men. Rygaard and Conner Aviation hope their new greenhorns fare better than the last class.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.desc: The final week of logging's toughest season begins. Impossible goals leave no room for error, as each crew races the clock.

programme.desc: From mountaintop to river's bottom, six crews will take on one of America's deadliest jobs.

programme.desc: As the summer heats up, so do the men of the mountain. Rygaard breaks in its greenhorns, while Jay Browning takes a gamble on a new yarder operator.

programme.desc: The forest fights back as a careless mistake at Browning threatens to take out DJ and Cody. At Rygaard, Gabe gives his greenhorns an ultimatum.

programme.desc: Logging country is under siege. Melvin's gung-ho attitude puts the crew in danger. Rygaard's greenhorns fight for a permanent spot on the crew.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, Chum and a host of colleagues from the shop remember Richard Benjamin Harrison, "the Old Man," in some of the best moments over a decade of funny jabs, odd sayings, fierce negotiations and great buys.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: All engines rev when Corey flips a limited-edition Dodge Demon; a vintage suit worn by the legendary Dale Earnhardt Sr. sends Corey and Chumlee racing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick flies across the pond to look at an epic "Star Wars" collection, including an iconic prop from the movie; a seller phones home with everyone's favorite Ewok; a new employee at the shop works with Corey to make a deal on a Planters jar.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A medal believed to be a Polish white eagle is brought into the shop; Corey and Chumlee check out a brick from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway; Chumlee makes the perfect home brew.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of tickets to the Beatles film, "A Hard Day's Night" is brought in to the shop; an 1850s Indian Peace Medal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A gold and silver Remington Arms gun comes into the shop; a collection of Mr.T dolls come into the store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A medal from British explorer Captain Cook comes into in the shop; Chum checks out a golf putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational; Chumlee tries to calm Rick down when his stress level hits a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman shield movie prop from Cleopatra comes into the shop; a 1922 silver peace dollar rolls in; the guys discuss their generations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1965 Panama Canal service medal is presented to the shop; Corey sets his sights on a renaissance era crossbow; Chumlee finds himself in hot water after he fails to call in an expert.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1906 silver half dollar that belonged to a passenger on the Titanic comes into the shop; a first edition of "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde"; a 1936 Zeiss 16mm camera.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A WWE Hall of Fame ring is brought into the shop; Corey checks out a 1927 Essex Sedan rat rod; an 1891 $1 silver certificate.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War general's sword; a veterinary medicine box from the 1800s; a pair of space toy robots from the 1960s; a 1936 Olympic pin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 19th century sun dial cannon; a signed helmet from one of Hollywood's biggest flops, "Heaven's Gate;" sterling silver baby figurines; a 1964 Beatles board game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Limited-edition Batman and Joker Bolin guitars; a bronze sculpture by M.L. Snowden; a pair of signed Betty Crocker letters; a WWII-era Adolf Hitler pincushion.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by actor Anthony Perkins ("Psycho"); an 1882 Gold Certificate and a 1918 Federal Reserve note; an 1800s Millionaire Calculator; a 1950s Russian night-vision scope.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick considers paying 10 times the face value of a rare $1,000 star note; a World War II Navy gun scope; an ancient bronze statue; a storyboard from the TV movie, "How the Grinch Stole Christmas."

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rumors run wild in Orange, California when 6 lockers--owned by one tenant--go up for auction. Dave and Darrell vie for a unit with a 12 grand payday. Barry Weiss stumbles across a vintage magazine. One buyer nearly breaks a hip.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go south to Laguna Nigel, California. This time it's Dave who doesn't buy. Jarrod and Brandi uncover rare depression era art. Barry's art goes a little further back, to the Mayan culture.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers invade the quiet town of Simi Valley, CA. Darrell and Brandon smoke the competition. Jarrod and Brandi find some safes, "release the Kraken," and walk away with literally a pirate's booty.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers venture back to the notorious vault auction, this time in Chattsworth, CA. Jarrod and Brandi find something that makes noise, if not money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers, well most of them, head to Westminster, CA. Darrell and Brandon meet a legend. Jarrod and Brandi do the right thing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go to Moreno Valley, Calif.; Darrell tries to play nice; Barry Weiss lands an uncertain score.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi attempt to stay focused on a big score as Dave returns with more bluster than ever; Ivy's treasure promises fun on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: There are roses for some and thorns for others as the buyers face off in Lake Elsinore, Calif.; Dave arrives with unanticipated optimism, but that doesn't stop him from stirring up trouble; Ivy has to pound unfamiliar pavement.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers face 10 vaults belonging to the same owner; Ivy draws a nice profit; Mary and Kenny do all of the heavy lifting.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Victorville, Calif., Ivy takes it easy and lets Ivy Jr. run the operation; Kenny feels run-down and his lack of focus lands him a locker, though there's a pleasant surprise in the end; Mary, Shana and Edwina just can't seem to make anything stick.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry rolls up to Riverside, Calif., with his own masked bidder, and the two develop a winning strategy; Brandi and Danielle's mystery balls take them to South America... sort of; Rene needs a cleanse after going through his risqu√© room.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: San Bernardino, Calif., brings out the warrior in Ivy, who goes up against an upstart buyer; Kenny has his eye on a locker that leaves him needing a massage; Lisa angles for a smaller unit but ends up with the catch of the day.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry believes all the whales are coming to the big auction in Fullerton as he takes Dusty under his wing to test him; Rene makes some dainty discoveries; Darrell's tool locker becomes quite eye-opening.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Laura's on her own in Moreno Valley, and she's anything but discreet about the reasons; Brandi cooks up a nice profit; Rene's doll locker yields a couple surprises, while Ivy dabbles with a bit of the supernatural.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Rebecca returns home from her internship in Los Angeles, the Robertson family plans a big surprise party to welcome her back.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interview her cousin, JD. Willie is hesitant at first, but immediately hits it off with JD, who truly appreciates Willie's sense of humor.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old GI Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep them selves.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: In the war for supremacy on the winter roads, Polar Industries has pulled ahead of rival VP Express.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The battle for winter roads supremacy turns personal when VP Express boss Hugh Rowland steals a driver from Polar Industries.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski races to complete one of Polar's most critical hauls of the season after a dashboard fire nearly costs him more than just a paycheck.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The landscape in the battle for winter roads supremacy is shaken to the core as Art Burke locks horns with VP Express bosses Hugh Rowland and Vlad Plescott.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Drivers Lisa Kelly, Alex Debogorski, Art Burke and Darrel Ward all attempt to conquer a remote, unmonitored trail, as the battle for Ice Road supremacy presses on.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the end of the season nears, Polar tries to fulfill their contract over the unregulated road to Utik Lake. But when a jackknifed truck blocks the remote trail.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With only days remaining in the season to determine the load count winner, Polar and VP Express race to deliver hauls over the rapidly melting roads.

programme.desc: As the ice roads melt away, Polar and VP Express are neck and neck in the load count.

programme.desc: As the season opens, the race begins for VP Express and Polar Industries.
